body_html:
It seems this started in #6681. That's a big commitment on our part. I'm not sure TensorFlow stored data would be portable between such systems. Can't these CPUs simulate little endian?

Would it be possible for grpcio to update their setup.py so, if the system is big endian, it favors linking OpenSSL from the system, rather than compiling BoringSSL from scratch?

Would it be possible for grpcio to update their setup.py so, if the system is big endian, it favors linking OpenSSL from the system, rather than compiling BoringSSL from scratch?
body:
It seems this started in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/6681. That's a big commitment on our part. I'm not sure TensorFlow stored data would be portable between such systems. Can't these CPUs simulate little endian?

Would it be possible for grpcio to update their setup.py so, if the system is big endian, it favors linking OpenSSL from the system, rather than compiling BoringSSL from scratch?
